title: Nick Dondas
text:
Nicholas Manuel Dondas (born 26 October 1939) is a former <a href="Country%20Liberal%20Party">Country Liberal</a> politician in the <a href="Northern%20Territory">Northern Territory</a>, <a href="Australia">Australia</a>, representing the seat of <a href="Electoral%20division%20of%20Casuarina">Casuarina</a> in the <a href="Northern%20Territory%20Legislative%20Assembly">Northern Territory Legislative Assembly</a> from 1974 to 1994, and the <a href="Division%20of%20Northern%20Territory">Division of Northern Territory</a> in the <a href="Australian%20House%20of%20Representatives">Australian House of Representatives</a> from 1996 to 1998.
Dondas was born in <a href="Perth%2C%20Western%20Australia">Perth</a>, and attended Christian Brothers College, Highgate, and Perth Boys High School. After moving to <a href="Darwin%2C%20Northern%20Territory">Darwin</a>, he married Cheryl Jones on 26 August 1972, with whom he had one daughter. He was involved with the Northern Suburbs Community Development Association and the Darwin Regional Tourist Association before entering politics, and was also a keen <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> player.
As a member of the Legislative Assembly, Dondas served as a minister from 1979 to 1987 under <a href="Paul%20Everingham">Paul Everingham</a>, <a href="Ian%20Tuxworth">Ian Tuxworth</a> and <a href="Stephen%20Hatton">Stephen Hatton</a>. He was deputy leader of the CLP, and hence <a href="Deputy%20Chief%20Minister%20of%20the%20Northern%20Territory">Deputy Chief Minister</a>, from 1983 to 1987 under Everingham and Tuxworth.
Dondas left the CLP to run unsuccessfully as an Independent for the <a href="electoral%20division%20of%20Port%20Darwin">electoral division of Port Darwin</a> at the <a href="2001%20Northern%20Territory%20legislative%20election">2001 Northern Territory election</a>.
